ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
aws_sdk_cpp:
- 1.11.606
azure_core_cpp:
- 1.16.1
azure_identity_cpp:
- 1.13.2
azure_storage_blobs_cpp:
- 12.15.0
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
fmt:
- '12.1'
folly:
- 2025.04.14.00
gflags:
- '2.2'
glog:
- '0.7'
libabseil:
- '20250512'
libboost_devel:
- '1.88'
libevent:
- 2.1.12
liblzma_devel:
- '5'
libprotobuf:
- 6.31.1

- 0.9.22

- '1.10'
msgpack_c:
- '6'
nodejs:
- '18'
numpy:
- '2'
openssl:
- '3.5'
pcre2:
- '10.47'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
spdlog:
- '1.17'
target_platform:
- linux-64
xxhash:
- 0.8.2
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version
zstd:
- '1.5'

about.description:
**ArcticDB** is a high performance, serverless **DataFrame database** built for
the Python Data Science ecosystem. Launched in March 2023, it is the successor
to [Arctic](https://github.com/man-group/arctic).
ArcticDB offers an intuitive Python-centric API enabling you to read and write
Pandas DataFrames to S3 or LMDB utilising a fast C++ data-processing and
compression engine.
about.summary: ArcticDB is a high performance, serverless DataFrame database built for the Python Data Science ecosystem.

commands: ARCTICDB_RAND_SEED=$RANDOM pytest python/tests --verbose --reruns 5 --reruns-delay 1 -k "not Azure and not azurite and not test_lmdb_warnings_when_reopened and not test_force_compact_symbol_list_lock_held_past_ttl and not test_write_non_timestamp_index and not test_write_not_sorted_multi_index_exception and not test_map_size_bad_input and not test_map_size_parsing and not lmdb and not test_column_stats_string_column_minmax and not test_filter_numeric_isnotin_signed and not test_filter_numeric_isnotin_unsigned and not test_compat_ and not test_modify_old_library_option_with_current and not test_pandas_pickling and not test_storage_mover_clone_old_library and not test_write_new_read_old and not test_mean_timestamp_aggregation_with_missing_aggregation_column and not test_resample and not test_norm_meta_column_and_index_names_write_old_read_new and not test_norm_meta_column_and_index_names_write_new_read_old and test_scan_object_sizes_by_stream_threading"

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "arcticdb" %}
{% set version = "6.7.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/man-group/ArcticDB/archive/refs/tags/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: b1e1c1ec8082fd06e11496929c6cf37490645f5438c4d5484ba77dda66b8c3fc

build:
  number: 0

  entry_points:
    - arcticdb_update_storage = arcticdb.scripts.update_storage:main

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - cmake
    - make
    - sccache
    - python                                  # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - numpy                                   # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - grpcio-tools                            # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - protobuf                                # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}      # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - libprotobuf                             # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - pkg-config                              # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - gnuconfig                               # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    # This environment specification must be maintained in sync with the one upstream:
    # See: https://github.com/man-group/ArcticDB/blob/master/environment_unix.yml
    # Note that some dependencies' versions are constrained in `conda_build_config.yaml`
    # because specifying it here does not overide the conda-forge's global pinning.
    - python
    - setuptools
    - numpy
    - pip
    - libboost-devel
    - liblzma-devel
    - folly
    - lz4-c
    - prometheus-cpp
    - double-conversion
    - libevent
    - libabseil
    - libprotobuf
    - openssl
    # TODO: understand why libcurl >=8.17 causes runtime failures
    - libcurl <8.17
    # TODO: Fix builds for missing symbols
    # See: https://github.com/man-group/ArcticDB/pull/1050
    - libmongocxx <3.9
    - zstd
    - pybind11
    - pcre2
    - gflags
    - msgpack-c
    - aws-sdk-cpp
    - azure-core-cpp
    - azure-identity-cpp
    - azure-storage-blobs-cpp
    - bitmagic
    - xxhash
    - semimap
    - grpcio-tools
    - protobuf
    - spdlog
    - unordered_dense
    - recycle
    - lmdb
    - lmdbxx
    - fmt
    - glog
    - gtest
    - benchmark
    - entt
    - sparrow-devel >=1.1.2,<2
  run:
  # This environment specification must be maintained in sync with the one upstream:
  # See: https://github.com/man-group/ArcticDB/blob/master/environment_unix.yml
  # See install_requires: https://github.com/man-group/ArcticDB/blob/master/setup.cfg
    - glog
    - python
    # To keep in sync with `install_requires` in setup.cfg.
    - pandas
    - attrs
    - decorator
    - msgpack-python >=0.5.0
    - psutil
    - pyyaml
    # Resolves https://github.com/man-group/ArcticDB/issues/465
    - aws-crt-cpp >=0.19.8
    - prometheus-cpp
    - protobuf >=3.5.1
    - lmdb
    - packaging
    # TODO: understand why libcurl >=8.17 causes runtime failures
    - libcurl <8.17
test:
  requires:
  # This environment specification must be maintained in sync with the one upstream:
  # See: https://github.com/man-group/ArcticDB/blob/master/environment_unix.yml
  # See `options.extras_require`: https://github.com/man-group/ArcticDB/blob/master/setup.cfg
    - pytest
    - polars
    - pytest-cpp
    - pytest-timeout
    - packaging
    - future
    - mock
    - boto3
    - moto
    - flask  # Used by moto
    - flask-cors
    - hypothesis <6.73
    - azure-storage-blob
    - azure-identity
    - coverage
    - asv
    - virtualenv
    - pymongo
    - mock
    - trustme
    - psutil
    - retrying
    # Memray and pytest-memray are not available on Windows, so we skip them for now.
    - memray                          # [unix]
    - pytest-memray                   # [unix]
    # PyArrow constraints the environment too much on Windows, so we skip it for now.
    - pyarrow                         # [unix]
  # Extra dependencies
    - pytest-rerunfailures
    - nodejs  # for npm
  source_files:
    - python/tests
  imports:
    - arcticdb
  commands:
    - npm install -g azurite
    # Skip slow tests, which includes the ones for MongoDB and Azure Blob Storage
    # See: https://github.com/conda-forge/arcticdb-feedstock/issues/151
    # See: https://github.com/conda-forge/arcticdb-feedstock/issues/152
    - export ARCTICDB_FAST_TESTS_ONLY=1
    # Machines have 2 CPUs, we retry in case of failure to be sure all configurations' builds are published.
    #
    # For now, we skip the following tests:
    #  - Tests for Azure are deactivated for now (not present for MacOS, fails for Linux).
    #  - `test_lmdb_warnings_when_reopened` also currently fails.
    #  - `test_column_stats_string_column_minmax` fails for linux.
    #  - `test_force_compact_symbol_list_lock_held_past_ttl` also currently fails for MacOS.
    #  - `test_filter_numeric_isnotin_signed` is generally flaky
    #  - for `test_write_non_timestamp_index`, see #246
    #  - for `test_write_not_sorted_multi_index_exception`, see #247
    #  - `test_compat` - remove after arcticdb #2194 is merged
    #  - `test_modify_old_library_option_with_current` - fails despite pyarrow present, investigate
    #  - `test_pandas_pickling` - fails despite pyarrow present, investigate
    #  - `test_storage_mover_clone_old_library` - fails despite pyarrow present, investigate
    #  - `test_write_new_read_old` - fails despite pyarrow present, investigate
    #  - `test_mean_timestamp_aggregation_with_missing_aggregation_column` - disparity between arcticdb and pandas in handling of default floating point values, pending fix
    #  - `test_resample` is generally flaky
    #  - `test_norm_meta_column_and_index_names_write_old_read_new` and `test_norm_meta_column_and_index_names_write_new_read_old`
    #     - They are flaky compat tests. Should be reenabled once fixed
    - ARCTICDB_RAND_SEED=$RANDOM pytest python/tests --verbose --reruns 5 --reruns-delay 1 -k "not Azure and not azurite and not test_lmdb_warnings_when_reopened and not test_force_compact_symbol_list_lock_held_past_ttl and not test_write_non_timestamp_index and not test_write_not_sorted_multi_index_exception and not test_map_size_bad_input
      and not test_map_size_parsing and not lmdb and not test_column_stats_string_column_minmax and not test_filter_numeric_isnotin_signed and not test_filter_numeric_isnotin_unsigned and not test_compat_ and not test_modify_old_library_option_with_current and not test_pandas_pickling and not test_storage_mover_clone_old_library
      and not test_write_new_read_old and not test_mean_timestamp_aggregation_with_missing_aggregation_column and not test_resample and not test_norm_meta_column_and_index_names_write_old_read_new and not test_norm_meta_column_and_index_names_write_new_read_old and test_scan_object_sizes_by_stream_threading"

about:
  home: https://arcticdb.io/
  summary: ArcticDB is a high performance, serverless DataFrame database built for the Python Data Science ecosystem.
  description: |
    **ArcticDB** is a high performance, serverless **DataFrame database** built for
    the Python Data Science ecosystem. Launched in March 2023, it is the successor
    to [Arctic](https://github.com/man-group/arctic).
    ArcticDB offers an intuitive Python-centric API enabling you to read and write
    Pandas DataFrames to S3 or LMDB utilising a fast C++ data-processing and
    compression engine.
  license: BUSL-1.1
  license_family: OTHER
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  doc_url: https://docs.arcticdb.io
  dev_url: https://github.com/man-group/ArcticDB

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - maxim-morozov
    - ognyanstoimenov
    - joe-iddon
    - G-D-Petrov
    - IvoDD
    - Hind-M
    - Klaim
    - JohanMabille
    - DerThorsten
    - jjerphan
    - mehertz
    - jamesmunro
    - qc00
    - willdealtry
    - poodlewars
    - vasil-pashov
    - phoebusm
    - alexowens90
